items.sentence: I don\'t really want to talk about this now.
I don\'t think Tom would do that on purpose.
Tom said he was concerned about the problem.
Tom said he was interested in buying a farm.
Tom said he was looking for more volunteers.
Tom said he was tired and wanted to go home.
The children tried to imitate their teacher.
The director wants to see you in his office.
The garden was surrounded by a wooden fence.
Tom and Mary are planning to move to Boston.
Tom asked Mary to help him clean his office.
Tom can\'t understand why Mary got so angry.
Tom claims that he can read people\'s minds.
I\'m going to go tell Tom that you\'re back.
I\'m fairly certain Tom doesn\'t believe us.
I\'m fed up with the way Tom\'s been acting.
I appreciate everything you\'ve done for us.
I appreciate the offer, but I can\'t accept.
I appreciated my neighbor\'s generous offer.
I assume that Tom doesn\'t know how to swim.
